title: Foundation: Degree in Social Sciences or Law
description: A bachelor's degree in Political Science, Economics, International Relations, Law, or a related field is essential. This provides the theoretical framework for understanding governance, policy, and socio-economic issues.
skills: Understanding of political and economic systems

title: Get Involved at the Grassroots Level
description: For aspiring politicians, this is crucial. Join the youth wing of a political party, volunteer for election campaigns, and get involved in community work in your local area. This builds a network and an understanding of public issues.
qualifications: Active membership in a political or community organization
institutes: Youth wings of major political parties

title: Research Assistant / Junior Policy Analyst
description: For the policy analyst path, join a think tank, a research institute, or work as a research assistant for a university or a senior politician. This is where you learn to conduct research, analyze data, and write policy briefs.
qualifications: Master's Degree in Public Policy/Economics (highly recommended)

title: Contest Elections / Policy Analyst
description: Politician: With a strong local base, contest for a position in a Local Government body (Pradeshiya Sabha, Urban Council) or a Provincial Council. Policy Analyst: Become a full-fledged analyst, leading research projects and publishing reports that influence public debate and policymaking.

title: Member of Parliament / Senior Policy Advisor
description: Politician: Rise to the national level by contesting for a seat in Parliament. This allows you to participate in national law-making. Policy Analyst: Become a senior advisor to a government ministry, a political leader, or an international organization, directly shaping national policy.
